It has a national/local problem where they hear that things are good or bad everywhere, except locally that doesn‚Äôt match, so they may respond with a national assessment that they can‚Äôt verify instead of a local one that they can. So, the polls are likely more in line with the national talking points and less with actual unbiased answers about their particular neck of the woods. In short, lies, fabrications, and political biases aren‚Äôt to be totally trusted. The trends may still be helpful, but don‚Äôt count too much on it.
